description: Installation of ventilation system and provision of kitchen at basement level and relocation of flue duct to side/rear of property
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.

Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed P200 Rev 1; P210 Rev 1; P250; P260; P310; P350; ANNEX A-VENTILATION SYSTEM-SPECIFICATIONS (Uploaded 02/10/2023). 
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.

Condition : 3 - The operating times of the ventilation system be restricted to between 0800hrs and 2300hrs to protect neighbouring residential properties from possible noise disturbance. 
Reason: To protect the amenities of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy LP2 of the Local Plan (2023).

Condition : 4 - The plant hereby permitted shall be installed in strict accordance with the details and recommended noise mitigation provided in the Noise Impact Assessment report submitted by DAA Group issue 1 dated the 25th of September 2023. The plant shall not be used unless the equipment is installed in compliance with these details. The plant shall be serviced regularly in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions and as necessary to ensure that the requirements of the condition are maintained. The accompanying odour mitigation systems shall be installed in accordance with approved plans/reports/details. If at any time the plant is determined by the local planning authority to be failing to comply with this condition, it shall be switched off upon written instruction from the local planning authority and not used again until it is able to comply.
Reason: To protect the amenities of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy LP2 of the Local Plan (2023).

Condition : 5 - The proposed ductwork shall be fitted to the building using ani-vibration isolators as per section 5.5.2 of the Noise Impact Assessment (P350).
Reason: To protect the amenities of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy LP2 of the Local Plan (2023).

Condition : 6 - The equipment hereby permitted must be removed within one month (and the land restored to its former condition) should the use of the kitchen cease in the future, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.
Reason: If the equipment is no longer required, there is no reason for the equipment to be retained given its visual impact on the residential terrace in line with policy LP2 of the Local Plan (2023).

Condition : 7 - Details of the finish of the flue (including paint colour and finish) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The approved details shall be installed prior to the commencement of the use of the equipment and shall be so maintained. 
Reason: To protect the amenities of neighbouring occupiers and the use of the terrace, in accordance with policy LP2 of the Local Plan (2023).

Condition : 8 - The proposed flue shall be mounted only to the mortar of the building ensuring bricks are left intact. 
Reason: To protect the heritage of the building and the conservation area in accordance with Policies LP1 and LP3 of the Local Plan (2023).
